problem_text: Axiomatizing the basic properties of subnormal subgroups, we say that a functor τ associating with every finite group G some non-empty set τ(G) of its subgroups is an ETP-functor if 1) τ(A)φ ⊆ τ(B) and τ(B)φ−1 ⊆ τ(A) for any epimorphism φ : A 7−→ B, as well as {H ∩ R | R ∈ τ(G)} ⊆ τ(H) for any subgroup H ⩽ G; 2) τ(H) ⊆ τ(G) for any subgroup H ∈ τ(G); 3) τ(G) is a sublattice of the lattice of all subgroups of G. Let τ be an ETP-functor. Does there exist a hereditary formation F such that τ(G) coincides with the set of all F-subnormal subgroups in any finite group G? This is true for finite soluble groups (A. F. Vasil’ev, S. F. Kamornikov, Siberian Math. J., 42, no. 1 (2001), 25–33). A. F. Vasil’ev, S. F. Kamornikov
answer: Not always (S. F. Kamornikov, Math. Notes, 89, no. 3–4 (2011), 340–348).
